intro: Dactylostegium portoricense, commonly known as the Portuguese velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain areas.
